intro: Ascocentrum curvifolium, commonly known as the curly-leaf arrowroot, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including countries like Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green, wavy leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically hidden within a spadix, surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. Ascocentrum curvifolium is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in humid, warm environments.
